<h3 className="c-secondary">Testable Criteria 1.1.0: Algorithmic Collusion</h3>
<b>Outcome: AI Model should not be recommending pricing strategies solely based on another company's business model.</b>

<h3 className="c-secondary">Testable Criteria 1.2.0: Algorithmic Exclusion and Predation</h3>
<b>Outcome: AI Model should not be recommending pricing strategies that result in exlusion or predation.</b>

<table>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <th style={{padding: "10px"}}>No.</th>
      <th>Question</th>
      <th>Relation to Outcome</th>
      <th>Response</th>
      <th>Elaboration</th>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>1.2.1</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Are the AI model's pricing algorithms transparent and traceable to identify instances of below-cost* pricing that could be considered predatory if the company considers itself to be dominant?
      <br />_*Price below average variable cost by a dominant company is likely to be predatory. Companies that are not dominant, or pricing above average total cost, are unlikely to be engaging in predatory behaviour._</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Below-cost pricing by a dominant market player could be anti-competitive and harm competition.<br />Transparency and traceability in the AI model's pricing algorithms to identify instances of below-cost pricing can ensure that pricing strategies are not predatory.</td>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>
        <select id="1_2_1" value={props.data["1_2_1"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_1",e.target.value)}>
          <option value="" disabled selected>Select an option</option>
          <option value="NA">Not Applicable</option>
          <option value="Yes">Yes</option>
          <option value="No">No</option>
        </select>
      </td>
      <td>
        <textarea style={{resize: "none"}} className="aiv-textarea" rows={10} cols={24} type="" id="1_2_1_e" value={props.data["1_2_1_e"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_1_e",e.target.value)} />
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>1.2.2</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Does the AI model undergo regular audits and reviews to detect and prevent instances of below-cost* pricing that could be indicative of predatory behavior if the company considers itself to be dominant?
      <br />_*Price below average variable cost by a dominant company is likely to be predatory. Companies that are not dominant, or pricing above average total cost, are unlikely to be engaging in predatory behaviour._</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Below-cost pricing by a dominant market player could be anti-competitive and harm competition.
      <br />Regular audits and reviews of the AI model help detect and prevent instances of below-cost pricing.</td>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>

          <option value="NA">Not Applicable</option>
          <option value="Yes">Yes</option>
          <option value="No">No</option>
        </select>
      </td>
      <td>
        <textarea style={{resize: "none"}} className="aiv-textarea" rows={10} cols={24} type="" id="1_2_2_e" value={props.data["1_2_2_e"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_2_e",e.target.value)} />
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>1.2.3</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Does the AI model's pricing algorithm consider relevant cost factors and market conditions to avoid setting prices below the companyâ€™s cost*, which could be considered predatory if the company considers itself to be dominant? 
      <br />_*Price below average variable cost by a dominant company is likely to be predatory. Companies that are not dominant, or pricing above average total cost, are unlikely to be engaging in predatory behaviour._</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Below-cost pricing by a dominant market player could be anti-competitive and harm competition.
      <br />Considering relevant cost factors and market conditions in the AI model's pricing algorithm helps avoid setting prices below a reasonable cost threshold.</td>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>
        <select id="1_2_3" value={props.data["1_2_3"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_3",e.target.value)}>
          <option value="" disabled selected>Select an option</option>
          <option value="NA">Not Applicable</option>
          <option value="Yes">Yes</option>
          <option value="No">No</option>
        </select>
      </td>
      <td>
        <textarea style={{resize: "none"}} className="aiv-textarea" rows={10} cols={24} type="" id="1_2_3_e" value={props.data["1_2_3_e"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_3_e",e.target.value)} />
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>1.2.4</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>If the company considers itself to be dominant, are there processes in place to monitor and address any feedback or complaints related to predatory/below-cost* pricing that may be linked to the AI model's algorithmic decisions?
      <br />_*Price below average variable cost by a dominant company is likely to be predatory. Companies that are not dominant, or pricing above average total cost, are unlikely to be engaging in predatory behaviour._</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Below-cost pricing by a dominant market player could be anti-competitive and harm competition.
      <br />Monitoring and addressing feedback ensure accountability and responsiveness to any predatory behavior.</td>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>
        <select id="1_2_4" value={props.data["1_2_4"]} onChange={(e)=>props.onChangeData("1_2_4",e.target.value)}>
          <option value="" disabled selected>Select an option</option>
          <option value="NA">Not Applicable</option>
          <option value="Yes">Yes</option>
          <option value="No">No</option>

      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>1.2.5</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>If the company considers itself to be dominant, does the AI company ensure that the AI model does not have loyalty-inducing algorithms that could have potential lock-in effects which may limit choices of downstream deployers and users, and discourage market entry for new developers?
      <br />_Examples of loyalty-inducing algorithms could include price discounts based on volume of purchase or years of subscription._</td>
      <td style={{paddingBottom: "15px"}}>Checks whether a dominant AI developer has developed a model with loyalty inducing algorithms that may deter entry of new AI developers and harm competition if the company has a dominant market position.</td>
      <td style={{padding: "10px 10px 15px 10px"}}>
